text:
Title: 2025 Yokosuka Chuo Illumination Photo Contest

Datetime:
- Photo contest entry period: Dec 1, 2025 (Mon) - Jan 31, 2026 (Sat)
- Illumination lighting period: Dec 1, 2025 - Mar 22, 2026
- Lighting hours (illumination): From sunset to 24:00 (midnight)

Place:
- Along Chuo Odori Avenue, Y Deck, and the plaza under Y Deck (Yokosuka-Chuo area)
- Address area: Wakamatsu-cho 2-chome, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa (and surrounding spots)

Detail:
- Take your best winter illumination photo in the Yokosuka-Chuo area and submit it via Instagram.
- How to enter:
- Themes (choose one):
- Nostalgic: #ノスタルジック
- Romantic: #ロマンティック
- Winter Cool: #ウィンタークール
- Everyone can join as long as you agree to the entry rules.

Attention:
- Winners will be contacted by Instagram Direct Message during February 2026, so make sure your account can receive DMs.
- Prizes (approx.):
- Grand Prize: Selectable Domestic Wagyu (catalog gift, about ¥30,000) - 1 winner
- Special Prize: 47CLUB catalog gift (about ¥10,000) - 1 winner per theme
- Honorable Mention: Prizes worth about ¥5,000 - 2 winners per theme
- Please read the contest rules before posting.
- Access: Keikyu “Yokosuka-Chuo” Station (East Exit), about 0-5 minutes on foot.

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/photocon-illumi.html
- Official Instagram: https://instagram.com/yokosukaxmaslights

Tags: Yokosuka, Yokosuka-Chuo, Winter illumination, Photo contest, Instagram, Night view, Kanagawa

Title: Uraga Brick Dry Dock Tour (Guided Tour)

Datetime:
- January 4 (Sun), meet at 09:30 / finish around 11:30 (held in light rain; canceled in severe weather)
- Application deadline: December 22 (Mon)

Place:
- Meeting point: Uraga Dock Main Gate (about a 10-minute walk from Keikyu Line “Uraga” Station)
- Disbanding point: In front of Uraga Community Center
- Address: 4-7 Uraga, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa, Japan

Detail:
- A guided walking tour of a historic brick-built dry dock constructed in 1899 (Meiji 32) and closed in 2003 (Heisei 15).
- Learn about the site’s shipbuilding/maintenance history (over 1,000 ships built on the slipway; many repairs and inspections in the dock) and view the dock from multiple angles.
- Course (approx. 1.0 km): briefing → jib crane → dock side → pump house → flap gate → tower crane remains → stairs → dock bottom → stairs → dock head → Uraga Community Center annex (local history museum). (The Brick Dock Utilization Center may be added if available.)

Attention:
- Advance application required (online via the organizer’s site); no postcard applications.
- Capacity: 50 people; lottery if oversubscribed.
- Fee: JPY 500 (elementary school students are free when accompanied by a guardian).
- Bring: drink, rain gear, mask, and any other necessities.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Transportation and any admission fees are additional.
- Accident compensation is limited to the organizer’s insurance coverage.
- Organizer / inquiries: NPO Yokosuka City Guide Association Office (TEL: 046-822-8256).

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-245.html
- Organizer / application information: http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html

Tags: yokosuka, uraga, guided-tour, history, industrial-heritage, dry-dock, walking-tour

Title: YOKOSUKA Fire Department Parade 2026 (消防出初式)

Datetime:
- Date: 2026-01-11 (Sun)
- Fureai Plaza: 09:30-12:00
- Parade: 10:30-11:11
- Traffic restriction (road closed both directions on Yokosuka Chuo Odori): 09:30-11:30
- Weather note: Cancelled in case of rain

Place:
- Parade route: Yokosuka Chuo Odori (from the National Route 16 side toward Yokosuka-Chuo Station)
- Fureai Plaza: Station-front plaza under the Yokosuka-Chuo Station Y-Deck

Detail:
- A New Year’s fire services parade held on Yokosuka Chuo Odori, featuring marching by the Fire Volunteer Band and Women’s Firefighting Team, plus a parade of fire and rescue vehicles.
- Vehicle parade participants include fire volunteer corps vehicles, Yokosuka City Fire Department vehicles, and U.S. Navy Yokosuka Base fire vehicles.
- Includes a ladder-truck rescue demonstration and other dynamic rescue performances.
- The Fureai Plaza area offers fire vehicle displays, fire volunteer recruitment promotion, and fire prevention/disaster preparedness outreach.

Attention:
- Road closure: Yokosuka Chuo Odori will be closed in both directions from 09:30 to 11:30 (the reopening time may be earlier).
- Viewing from the Y-Deck is not allowed for safety reasons.
- No dedicated parking for the parade—use public transportation.
- Event-day status can be confirmed from 08:00 via the Yokosuka City Call Center (Tel: 046-822-4000).

Link:
- https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/syoubou-parade.html
- https://www.city.yokosuka.kanagawa.jp/7410/syoubou/topics/r7pare-do.html

Tags: Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Festival, Parade, Fire Department, New Year, Family-friendly, Traffic restriction

Title: From Hayama’s Plum Village to Mineyama (Guided Hiking Tour)

Datetime:
- Date: Friday, February 13, 2026
- Meet: JR Kinugasa Station (受付 / check-in) 08:30-08:50
- End: Around 12:30 at Hayama Park Entrance bus stop
- Weather: Runs in light rain; canceled in severe weather

Place:
- Meeting point: JR Kinugasa Station, 2-1 Kinugasasakae-cho, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
- Finish: Hayama Park Entrance bus stop (葉山公園入口)

Detail:
- Type: Sports/Outdoor — Planned Guide Tour (pre-registration required)
- Capacity: 50 participants
- Fee: 500 JPY (elementary school students accompanied by a guardian: free)
- Application deadline: Friday, February 6
- What to bring: drinking water, small snacks, work gloves (nature trail), rain gear (depending on forecast)
- Route (approx. 5.7 km, for reasonably fit walkers):
- JR Kinugasa Station → Bus → Suigenchi-Iriguchi bus stop
- Shinzenko-ji Temple (toilet) → Imperial Villa Water Source area
- Old plum trees → Kannon Hall & the grave of Taira no Kanemori
- Kayakiyama Koshinto monument → Oike Pond (Mineyama)
- Chojagasaki (toilet) → Hayama Park Entrance bus stop

Attention:
- Transportation and any entrance fees are not included.
- If applications exceed capacity, participants will be chosen by lottery.
- Wear well-broken-in, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Accident coverage is limited to the organizer’s insurance scope.
- Bus costs (reference):
- JR Kinugasa Station → Suigenchi-Iriguchi bus stop: ~17 min / 350 JPY
- After the tour: Hayama Park Entrance bus stop → JR Zushi Station: ~19 min / 340 JPY
- Tour status on the day can also be checked via “Yokosuka Calendar” or the Yokosuka City Call Center (046-822-4000, 07:15-20:00).

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-251.html
- Organizer/official site: http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html

Tags: yokosuka, hayama, mineyama, guided-tour, hiking, outdoor, spring, plum-blossoms

Datetime:
- Year-round (weather-dependent)

Place:
- Hayama, Kanagawa (sailing school)

Attention:
- Activities depend on sea conditions; follow safety instructions and wear appropriate gear.

Tags: activity, sailing, marine-sports, experience

Title: Miura Clan Heritage Stamp Rally (Yokosuka City)

Datetime:
- 2025-11-14 (Fri) to 2026-01-04 (Sun)

Place:
- Yokosuka City, Kanagawa, Japan (23 Miura Clan-related locations across the city)

Detail:
- This is a city-wide stamp rally themed around the Miura clan, a warrior family that supported the founding of the Kamakura shogunate. Participants visit designated “stamp spots” and collect digital stamps using their smartphone’s GPS. After collecting stamps, you can apply for a prize drawing (luxury gifts are mentioned). The route is designed to be explored with a convenient digital map, and representative spots include Manshoji Temple, Manganji Temple, Arasaki Coast (Nagai Castle area), and Arai Castle area.

Attention:
- Participation is free, but you are responsible for smartphone data charges and transportation costs.
- Some “castle” spots are medieval sites; there may be no castle buildings or structures to see at those locations.
- You will need a smartphone with location services (GPS) enabled to obtain stamps.

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/miuraitizoku.html
- Official stamp rally info / digital map: https://www.cocoyoko.net/special/miuraichizoku.html

Tags: Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Miura clan, Kamakura period, history, stamp rally, digital map, temples, castle ruins

Title: Uraga Brick Dry Dock Tour (Guided Tour)

Datetime:
- January 18 (Sunday), 9:30 AM (meet) - around 11:30 AM (dismiss)

Place:
- Meeting point: In front of the Uraga Dock main gate (about a 10-minute walk from Uraga Station on the Keikyu Line)
- Dismissal point: In front of Uraga Community Center (annex)
- Address: 4-7 Uraga, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa, Japan

Detail:
- A guided walking tour that lets you experience the history of a brick-built dry dock. The dock was built in 1899 (Meiji 32) and remained in use for shipbuilding and repairs/inspections until its closure in 2003 (Heisei 15).
- Capacity: 50 participants
- Fee: 500 JPY (elementary school students are free if accompanied by a guardian)
- What to bring: drinks, rain gear, a mask, and anything else you may need
- Walking distance: about 1.0 km
- Sample route (highlights): briefing at the meeting point → jib crane → dock side → pump station → flap gate → tower crane remains → stairs → dock bottom → dock head → Uraga Community Center (local history museum)
- Registration: advance application required via the official website (no postcard applications). If applications exceed capacity, participants will be selected by lottery.
- Application deadline: January 5

Attention:
- Transportation costs and any admission fees are not included.
- The event may be canceled in severe weather.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- In case of accidents, compensation is limited to the scope of the organizer’s insurance coverage.
- You can confirm whether the event will be held via the Yokosuka calendar or by calling the Yokosuka City Call Center (7:15-20:00).

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-246.html
- Official site (application / information): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html

Tags: Yokosuka, Uraga, Guided tour, Heritage, Industrial history, Dry dock, Brick architecture, Walking tour, Yokosuka Route Museum

Title: Explore the Uraga Road “Mitori-ezu” Map (Part 4) — Guided Walking Tour

Datetime:
- Saturday, January 31, 2026
- Check-in: 9:00-9:30 (meet at **JR Kinugasa Station**)
- End: around 14:30 (disband at **Keikyu Otsu Station**)
- Cancelled in rain / severe weather

Place:
- Meeting point: **JR Kinugasa Station**, Yokosuka, Kanagawa (Kinugasa Sakaemachi 2-chome 1)
- Disband: **Keikyu Otsu Station**, Yokosuka, Kanagawa
- Route crosses the central Miura Peninsula through cut-throughs and hilly terrain

Detail:
- A guided tour that follows the “Uraga Road Mitori-ezu” route from Kinugasa toward Otsu, enjoying natural scenery and historic landforms.
- Distance: about **7.0 km** (recommended for fairly fit walkers).
- Planned course (in order):
- JR Kinugasa Station → Koshin-ji Temple → “Hoto” Crossroads → Kugō Kōshin-to Stone Monument Group → Kugō Shrine → Sōgen-ji (former site) → Myōshin-ji Temple → Negishi 5-chome Kōshin-to → Tenjinzaka Slope → Aizen Inari Shrine → Otsu Sports Park (lunch) → Otsu Jinya Ruins → Otsu Suwa Shrine → Shinsei-ji Temple → Shinraku-ji Temple → Keikyu Otsu Station

Attention:
- **Advance registration required**; application deadline: **Saturday, January 24**.
- Capacity: **50 people** (lottery if oversubscribed).
- Fee: **500 JPY** (elementary school students are free if accompanied by a guardian).
- Bring: lunch, drink, umbrella, and a ground sheet (plus anything else you may need).
- Transportation costs and any admission fees are **not included**.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Accident coverage is limited to the scope of the insurance held by the guide association.
- Event status can also be checked via the “Yokosuka Calendar” or Yokosuka City Call Center (046-822-4000, 7:15-20:00).

Link:
- https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/4.html
- Application/official tour site: http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html

Tags: Yokosuka, Guided walking tour, Uraga Road, Miura Peninsula, Nature scenery, Historic route, Temples and shrines, Hiking (7 km), January 2026

Title: Uraga Road Mitoriezu Walking Tour (Part 5): Toward the Uraga Magistrate’s Office Site

Datetime:
- Sat, Feb 21, 2026
- Check-in starts: 9:00 / Final check-in: 9:30
- Ends: around 14:40 (disband at Konya-cho Bus Stop)
- Weather: postponed in rain to Sat, Feb 28, 2026

Place:
- Meeting point: Keikyu Otsu Station (京急大津駅), Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Japan
- Address (meeting area): 1-11 Otsu-cho, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan

Detail:
- A planned guided walking tour (Sports/Outdoor) and the 5th session in the “Tour the Western Uraga Road” series.
- The tour aims for the former Uraga Magistrate’s Office site as the goal.
- Highlights include the historic Yanozu-zaka slope (once considered a difficult pass), a stop at Nishi Kanou Shrine (associated with prayers for the revival/restoration of the Uraga brick dock), and reporting at the Uraga Magistrate’s Office site after completing the route.
- Distance & difficulty: about 4.0 km; suitable for general participants.
- Capacity: 50 participants.
- Fee: 500 JPY (elementary school students accompanied by a guardian are free).
- What to bring: drinks, packed lunch, rain gear, and anything else you may need.

Attention:
- Advance application required. Application deadline: Sat, Feb 14 (year implied: 2026).
- Transportation costs and any admission fees are NOT included and must be paid separately.
- If there are too many applicants, participants will be selected by lottery.
- The tour may be cancelled in rain or severe weather.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Accident compensation is limited to the insurance coverage held by the Yokosuka City Guide Association.
- After disbanding: from Konya-cho Bus Stop
- To Uraga Station: ~5 minutes, 200 JPY
- To Keikyu Kurihama Station: ~12 minutes, 220 JPY

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-252.html
- Organizer official site: http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html
- Inquiries: NPO Yokosuka City Guide Association Office
- TEL: 046-822-8256 / FAX: 046-827-1682
- Day-of confirmation (hold/cancel):
- Yokosuka Calendar / Yokosuka City Call Center: 046-822-4000 (7:15-20:00)

Tags: Yokosuka, Uraga, Kanagawa, guided tour, walking tour, hiking, historical route, Uraga Brick Dock, Nishi Kanou Shrine, Uraga Magistrate’s Office site

Title: Uraga Brick Dry Dock Tour (Uraga Renga Dock Tour)

Datetime:
- February 15 (Sunday), 09:30 (meet) - around 11:30 (finish)
- Application deadline: February 2 (Monday)

Place:
- Meeting point: Uraga Dock Main Gate (about a 10-minute walk from Uraga Station on the Keikyu Line)
- Finish: In front of Uraga Community Center (Annex / Local History Museum)
- Address: 4-7 Uraga, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa, Japan

Detail:
- A guided tour that lets you experience the history of a brick-built dry dock. The dock was constructed in 1899 (Meiji 32) and was used until it closed in 2003 (Heisei 15). While the slipway built more than 1,000 ships, the dock was used for many repairs and inspections. You will view the site from many angles to appreciate its scale and engineering heritage.
- Walking course (about 1.0 km): meeting/orientation → jib crane → dock side wall → pump house → flap gate → tower crane remains → stairs → dock bottom → stairs → dock head → Uraga Community Center (disband). (If available, the Brick Dock Utilization Center may be added.)

Attention:
- Advance registration required (no postcard applications).
- Light rain: tour proceeds. Severe weather: canceled.
- Capacity: 50 people. If there are too many applications, participants will be chosen by lottery.
- Fee: 500 JPY (elementary school children are free if accompanied by a guardian).
- Bring: drinks, rain gear, mask, and anything else you think you may need.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers). Transportation costs and any admission fees are not included.
- In case of an accident, compensation is limited to the scope of the organizer’s insurance.

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-254.html
- Official site (application): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html
- Organizer (NPO Yokosuka City Guide Association Office): TEL 046-822-8256 / FAX 046-827-1682
- Day-of status check: Yokosuka Call Center 046-822-2500 (07:15-20:00)

Tags: Yokosuka, Uraga, Guided tour, Industrial heritage, Dry dock, Brick architecture, History walk, Route Museum

Title: Verny Park Guide Tour (Verny Park / Yokosuka)

Datetime:
- Saturdays from September to December 2025 (17 sessions total)
- Two sessions per day:
- 09:30-10:30 (capacity: 20)
- 11:00-12:00 (capacity: 20)
- Check-in starts 15 minutes before each session

Place:
- Meeting point: In front of the Verny Memorial Museum (Verny Kinenkan), 1-1 Higashi-Hemmi-cho, Yokosuka
- Tour area: Verny Park (Yokosuka)

Detail:
- A 1-hour walking guided tour led by the Yokosuka City Guide Association.
- Theme: the history of Japan’s modernization connected to the former Yokosuka Ironworks/Shipyard, and key figures such as the French engineer Verny and Tadayasu Oguri.
- Typical stops include:
- Verny Memorial Museum
- Battleship “Mutsu” main gun
- Hemmi Hatoba Guard Gate
- Thibodier House
- Oguri & Verny busts
- Price: 500 JPY per person (includes the guided tour + a 1-day “Mikasa Circulation Bus” pass)

Attention:
- Runs in rain; cancelled only in severe weather.
- The entire tour is on foot.
- No refund/exchange if you choose not to use the participant perks.
- Same-day participation may be possible if there is available capacity.
- Participant perks (with the “Mikasa Circulation Bus” 1-day pass):
- Discount for “Mikasa” (one of the world’s three great memorial battleships): 600 JPY → 300 JPY
- 10% off Yokosuka Naval Port Tour and Sarushima ferry routes
- Other Sunday guided courses are also offered (details are available via the booking site).

Link:
- Event page (Yokosuka Tourism Info): https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/verny-guide.html
- Booking / official course page: https://yokosukaguide.webnode.jp/course0booking/

Tags: yokosuka, verny-park, guided-tour, history, modernization, naval-heritage, weekend-event, mikasa

Title: Yokosuka Army (Fortress Command & Heavy Artillery Regiment) Footprints — Guided Walking Tour

Datetime:
- Saturday, January 24, 2026 (Reception starts 08:30; last check-in 09:00; finish around 12:30). Cancelled in severe weather.

Place:
- Meeting point: Shioiri Station (Keikyu Line), 2-41 Shioiri-cho, Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Japan
- Finish: Yokosuka-Chuo Station (Keikyu Line)

Detail:
- A pre-registration guided walking tour exploring traces of the former Japanese Army in Yokosuka (often known as a “naval town,” but also had an “army town” side in the old Toyoshima area).
- Distance: approx. 5.5 km (moderate; for people comfortable with a longer walk).
- Route: Shioiri Station → Konojinja Shrine → Yasaka Path → Bato Kannon → Iizuka Residence Grave → Former Heavy Artillery Regiment Site → Chicoku Slope → Former Army Hospital (WC) → Sairaiji Temple → Former Irido Training Ground → “Military Transfer” Memorial Tower → Kashiwagida → Former Fortress Command Site → Former Yonegahama Battery Site (WC) → Yokosuka-Chuo Station

Attention:
- Advance application required; application deadline: Saturday, January 17.
- Capacity: 50 people (lottery if there are too many applicants).
- Fee: 500 JPY (Elementary school students are free if accompanied by a guardian).
- Bring: drinks (and anything else you think you will need).
- Extra costs (transportation, admission fees, etc.) are not included.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Check whether the tour will be held on the day via the Yokosuka calendar or Yokosuka City Call Center: 046-822-4000 (07:15-20:00).
- In case of an accident, compensation is limited to the scope of the guide association’s insurance policy.

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-247.html
- Official site (Yokosuka City Guide Association): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html

Tags: yokosuka, kanagawa, guided-tour, walking-tour, military-history, fortress, pre-registration

Title: Yokosuka Countdown 2026 (よこすかカウントダウン 2026)

Datetime:
- 2025-12-31 (Wed) 18:00 - 2026-01-01 (Thu, Holiday) 01:00

Place:
- Verny Park (Verny Koen), “Ikoi no Hiroba” Square
- Address: 1-1 Shioiri-cho, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa, Japan

Detail:
- A New Year’s countdown event at Yokosuka Harbor featuring live stage performances, gourmet food booths, harbor illumination, and fireworks.
- Main highlights:
- Stage event (live music, dance, countdown ceremony)
- Food trucks and tent booths selling local gourmet
- Fireworks launched from the sea (about 500 shots) at midnight
- Illumination of naval vessels and the park to color Yokosuka’s main harbor, plus ship whistles for a Yokosuka-style New Year moment
- Stage timetable (as published):
- 18:00 Shonan Brass Community
- 18:45 Wind Orchestra “Sol-Leone”
- 19:20 Kyokushin Karate Yokosuka Dojo
- 19:45 Dance Studio AMUSE
- 20:30 Ichi-no-I (イチノイー)
- 21:00 Ship illumination / Yokosuka District (JMSDF) HQ building light-up
- 21:10 Kafue Moka (かふぇもか)
- 21:55 Gokuraku Dolce (極楽ドルチェ)
- 22:40 Signarion Ryuseigun (シグナリオン流星群)
- 23:20 Maeda Sara & Family Band
- 23:45 Countdown ceremony
- 00:00 Fireworks launch / ship whistle / searchlight
- 00:05 New Year live
- 00:20 Stage events end
- 01:00 Event ends
- Gourmet & vendor examples listed:
- SUNRISE BERTH, HONCH SHELL, Asian Goyanglidah, Cheese Mocchi in Suzuhihiro, Soba restaurant “Agataya”, STREAM, Restaurant TSUNAMI, South Denim Kitchen, Daddy’s Pizza, and more.

Attention:
- Event content may change or be cancelled without prior notice.
- Check whether the event will be held:
- Yokosuka City Call Center: +81-46-822-4000 (available from 08:00 on Dec 31)
- Event go/no-go: after 08:00
- Fireworks go/no-go: after 13:00
- Access:
- 5 minutes on foot from Keikyu Shioiri Station
- 5 minutes on foot from JR Yokosuka Station
- Parking is limited; please use public transportation when possible.
- The organizers are not responsible for accidents or trouble inside the parking area.
- Keikyu special timetable info is provided via the link below.

Link:
- https://www.cocoyoko.net/yoksuka-countdown/
- Keikyu special timetable: https://www.keikyu.co.jp/company/news/2025/20251128HP_25140TE.html

Tags: Yokosuka, Kanagawa, New Year, Countdown, Fireworks, Verny Park, Illumination, Food trucks, Live music

Title: Yokosuka Jazz Rock Festival (横須賀ジャズロックフェスティバル)

Datetime:
- Not specified in this source (please check the official festival page).

Place:
- Verny Park (ヴェルニー公園), Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Japan *(mentioned as a simultaneous event at the same venue)*

Detail:
- This festival is listed as another event held at Verny Park during the same period as the Yokosuka Winter Illumination.
- For schedules, performers, and venue details, refer to the festival website.

Attention:
- The PDF does not include dates, times, or program details—confirm on the official festival page.

Link:
- Festival page: https://www.wakuwaku-yokosuka.jp/special.php?ID=183

Tags: music, jazz, rock, festival, Verny Park, Yokosuka, Kanagawa, event

Title: Yokosuka Winter Illumination (横須賀ウィンターイルミネーション)

Datetime:
- 2025-10-31 (Fri) - 2026-01-04 (Sun) *(planned)*
- Lights on: 17:00
- Lights off: 22:00
- Note: Lighting hours may change depending on other events.

Place:
- Verny Park (ヴェルニー公園)
- Address: 1-1 Shioiri-cho, Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Japan
- Coordinates: 35°17'04.0"N, 139°39'26.3"E

Detail:
- Yokosuka City will light up the night scenery of Verny Park—known for its view toward Yokosuka Honko (the main port) and its orange-toned nightscape—using illumination themed around champagne gold.
- Decoration/illumination areas include:
- Planting strip (from the Shioiri side to Oguri Plaza)
- French-style flowerbed & lawn area (around the western-style gazebo and the fountain)
- Western-style gazebo
- Itsumi Hatoba Gate (逸見波止場衛門)
- Access:
- About 1 minute on foot from JR “Yokosuka” Station
- About 5 minutes on foot from Keikyu “Shioiri” Station
- Contact: Cultural, Sports & Tourism Department, Planning Division (Yokosuka City)
- Phone: +81-46-822-8427

Attention:
- Dates and hours are listed as *planned* and may change.
- Lighting time may shift due to other events.
- Consider checking the official pages before visiting, especially during holiday periods.

Link:
- Event page (CocoYoko): https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/winter-illumi.html
- Official city announcement: https://www.city.yokosuka.kanagawa.jp/2110/nagekomi/20251029_illumination.html

Tags: illumination, winter, night-view, Verny Park, Yokosuka, Kanagawa, event

Title: Helicopter Sightseeing Flight (Yokosuka)

Datetime:
- February 7 (Sat)-February 8 (Sun), 2026
- Flight operations: 10:00-15:30 (about 15 flights per day; varies by course)
- *New Year Campaign (5% OFF):* December 26 (Fri)-January 4 (Sun) — discount applies only if you complete a booking during this period using the coupon code (announced on Dec 26)

Place:
- Departure/arrival: Uraga City Marina Verasis Heliport, Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Japan
- Reception: Uraga City Marina Verasis, Parking Lot No. 2 (arrive 30 minutes before takeoff)

Detail:
- Scenic helicopter tours departing from/returning to the Uraga City Marina Verasis heliport.
- Routes & standard prices (price is per helicopter):
- Chiyogasaki Battery Ruins → Kannonzaki loop (~10 min): JPY 44,000 / helicopter
- Jogashima loop (~15 min): JPY 66,000 / helicopter
- Enoshima & Kamakura loop (~30 min): JPY 132,000 / helicopter
- Capacity/pricing rule: Up to 3 passengers per helicopter; the price is the same whether 1-3 people ride.
- New Year Campaign discounted prices (5% OFF, when eligible):
- ~10 min course: JPY 41,800 / helicopter

Title: Guided Tour: Explore Miura Clan Historic Sites and Buddhist Statues

Datetime:
- Date: Wednesday, February 4, 2026
- Check-in (reception): 9:00-9:30
- Approx. finish (dismissal): around 14:30
- Note: Cancelled in case of rain/bad weather

Place:
- Meeting point: (Keikyu Bus) Kinugasa Castle Ruins Bus Stop (衣笠城址バス停)
- Address (meeting area): 4 Kinugasa-cho, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
- Dismissal point: (Keikyu Bus) Iwato Bus Stop (岩戸バス停)

Detail:
- This is a planned guided walking tour visiting places associated with the Miura clan—often described as one of the largest warrior groups in Sagami Province—who played an important role in the founding era of the Kamakura shogunate.
- You will also visit temples to view nationally important Buddhist statues (Important Cultural Properties) and related historic sites.
- Capacity: 50 people (advance application required)
- Walking distance: about 5.0 km (recommended for strong walkers)
- What to bring: lunch and drinks; other items you may need (example: a walking stick)
- Participation fee: 500 JPY (elementary school students accompanied by a guardian: free)
- Additional temple viewing fees (separate): Daizen-ji 200 JPY, Seiun-ji 200 JPY, Mangan-ji 300 JPY (total 700 JPY)
- Deadline: Wednesday, January 28
- How to apply: From the official site’s top page, select “Tour Application” and apply for the relevant tour.
- Kinugasa Castle Ruins Bus Stop → Kinugasa Castle Ruins → Daizen-ji (main hall) → Mansho-ji (Miura Yoshiaki’s grave) → Yakkoji-ato site → Chikadono Shrine → Oyabe Neighborhood Hall (lunch) → Seiun-ji (main hall, Takimi Kannon, graves of three generations of the Miura clan) → Harakiri-matsu Park → Mangan-ji (Kannon & Jizo statues, grave of Sahara Yoshitsura) → Iwato Bus Stop

Attention:
- Transportation and admission/viewing fees are not included (paid separately).
- If there are many applications, participants may be selected by lottery.
- Please wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- In case of an accident, compensation is limited to the scope of the insurance held by the City Guide Association.
- Note: The nationally designated Important Cultural Property statue of Miura Yoshiaki at Mansho-ji is currently under repair and cannot be viewed.
- To the meeting point:
- Yokosuka-Chuo Station Bus Stop → Kinugasa Castle Ruins Bus Stop: ~17 min, 280 JPY
- YRP Nobi Station Bus Stop → Kinugasa Castle Ruins Bus Stop: ~18 min, 290 JPY
- After dismissal:
- Iwato Bus Stop → Kita-Kurihama Station Bus Stop: ~10 min, 260 JPY

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-249.html
- Official site (application): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html
- Contact (NPO Yokosuka City Guide Association Office): TEL +81-46-822-8256
- Yokosuka Call Center (event-day confirmation): +81-46-822-4000 (7:15-20:00)

Tags: Yokosuka, Kanagawa, Guided tour, Walking tour, Miura clan, Kamakura period, Historic sites, Temples, Buddhist statues, Cultural heritage

Title: Yokosuka Japan Heritage & Uninhabited Island Sarushima Exploration (Planned Guided Tour)

Datetime:
- Date: Wednesday, February 11, 2026
- Meeting/Check-in: JR Yokosuka Station (reception starts 09:00, last check-in 09:30)
- Dismissal: Around 15:00 at Port Market
- Application deadline: Wednesday, February 4, 2026

Place:
- Meeting point: JR Yokosuka Station
- Address (meeting area): 1-chome Higashi-Hemmi-cho, Yokosuka City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan
- Main route highlights: Verny Park → (view) U.S. Navy base → Dobuita Street → Mikasa Park promenade → Mikasa Pier → Ferry → Sarushima (island exploration & lunch) → Return → Port Market

Detail:
- A guided walking and ferry tour that explores Yokosuka’s modern industrial/military heritage (starting from the former Yokosuka Ironworks area) while enjoying views of modern Japanese and U.S. naval vessels.
- The tour includes a visit to Sarushima, described as the only natural island in Tokyo Bay, and features island exploration plus lunch time on the island.
- Walking distance: approx. 5.0 km (general fitness level).

Attention:
- Advance application required; if there are many applications, participants may be selected by lottery.
- The tour will be canceled in rain/rough weather, and also canceled if the Sarushima ferry route is suspended.
- Bring: drinks, a packed lunch, rain gear, and anything else you may need.
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Costs:
- Participation fee: 500 JPY (elementary school children are free if accompanied by a guardian)
- Additional required cost (Sarushima ferry + admission): Yokosuka residents 1,000 JPY / Non-residents 1,850 JPY
- Transportation and other admission fees may be extra.
- After the tour (Port Market → Mikasa Park loop bus): 15:18, 15:41.

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-250.html
- Application/official site (Yokosuka City Guide): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html
- Organizer (Yokosuka City Guide Association / NPO): Tel. +81-46-822-8256
- Yokosuka City Call Center (event status confirmation): +81-46-822-4000 (07:15-20:00)

- End point: **Uraga Dock Main Gate** (about a 10-minute walk back to Uraga Station after dismissal)

Detail:
- This is an advance-registration guided walk through **West Uraga** early in the new year.
- Highlights include:
- Learning local history at the **Uraga Local History Museum**
- Making a New Year visit to **Nishi Kanō Shrine**
- Visiting **Jofuku-ji Temple** to view the “Hell & Paradise” (地獄極楽図) Buddhist paintings
- Experiencing the shipbuilding heritage and memories at **Uraga Dock**
- Walking distance: about **2.5 km** (general-audience course)
- Organizer: **NPO Yokosuka City Guide Association**

Attention:
- **Advance application required** (capacity: **50 people**; lottery if oversubscribed).
- Application deadline: **Friday, January 9**.
- Participation fee: **JPY 500** (Elementary school children accompanied by a guardian are **free**).
- Bring: **rain gear** and **drinks** (plus anything else you think you may need).
- Extra costs: **transportation, admission fees, etc. are not included**.
- Footwear: wear **comfortable, non-slip shoes** (e.g., sneakers).
- In case of accidents, compensation is limited to the range covered by the guide association’s insurance.

Title: Uraga Brick Dock Tour (Guided Tour at a Historic Brick Dry Dock)

Datetime:
- February 1 (Sun), 9:30 (meet) - around 11:30 (dismissal)
- Light rain: held as planned / Severe weather: cancelled
- Application deadline: January 19 (Mon)

Place:
- Meeting point: In front of the Uraga Dock Main Gate (about 10 minutes on foot from Uraga Station on the Keikyu Line)
- Dismissal point: In front of the Uraga Community Center
- Address: 4-7 Uraga, Yokosuka City (Kanagawa, Japan)

Detail:
- This is a pre-registration guided tour where you can experience the history of a brick-built dry dock.
- The dock was built in 1899 (Meiji 32). Until its closure in 2003 (Heisei 15), the slipway built over 1,000 ships and the dock handled many repairs and inspections.
- Capacity: 50 people
- Fee: 500 JPY (Elementary school children accompanied by a guardian are free)
- What to bring: drinks, rain gear, a mask, and anything else you think you may need
- Application method: Apply via the official site from the top page’s right-side link “Yokosuka Historical Heritage: Uraga Dock Guidance” (applications by postcard are not accepted)
- Walking distance: about 1.0 km
- Route (planned):
- Meeting point (overview) → Jib crane → Dock side wall → Pump station → Flap gate → Tower crane remains → Stairs → Dock bottom → Stairs → Dock head area → Uraga Community Center Annex (Local History Museum) (dismissal)
- The Brick Dock Utilization Center may also be included if it is open for visits.

Attention:
- Transportation costs and any entrance fees are not included.
- If there are too many applicants, participants will be selected by lottery.
- Please wear well-broken-in, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- In case of an accident, compensation is limited to the scope of the organizer’s insurance policy.
- Check whether the tour will be held on the day via the Yokosuka Calendar or the Yokosuka City Call Center (046-822-2500, 7:15-20:00).

Link:
- Event page: https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-253.html
- Official site (application portal): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html
- Organizer contact (NPO Yokosuka City Guide Association Secretariat): TEL 046-822-8256 / FAX 046-827-1682

Tags: Yokosuka Route Museum, Guided tour, History & heritage, Uraga, Brick dry dock, Shipbuilding / maritime history, Outdoor walking

Title: Visit “Hanano Gosho” (Yoritomo-related site) and enjoy the daffodils on Jogashima Island (guided walking tour)

Datetime:
- Wednesday, January 28, 2026
- Meet/Check-in: Misakiguchi Station (Keikyu Line) — reception starts 8:30, final check-in 9:00
- Disband: Jogashima Bus Stop — around 15:00
- Note: Cancelled in rain / severe weather

Place:
- Meeting point: Misakiguchi Station (Keikyu Line), 495 Shimomiyada, Hasse-machi, Miura City, Kanagawa, Japan
- Main area: Misaki (Miura City) + Jogashima Island (walking tour)

Detail:
- A planned guide tour that explores the historic Misaki area (once prospering as a tuna landing port with many merchant houses), reflects on the “Hanano Gosho” connected to Minamoto no Yoritomo, and then crosses the Jogashima Bridge to visit a large colony of double-flowered daffodils (about 300,000 plants).
- Walking course (about 7.7 km, general level): Misakiguchi Station → bus to Misaki-Higashioka bus stop → temples/shrines in Misaki → Jogashima (poetry monument, Jogashima Park, viewpoints, rock formations, lighthouse) → Jogashima bus stop.

Attention:
- Advance application required; if applications exceed capacity, participants are selected by lottery.
- Capacity: 50 people.
- What to bring: lunch, drinks, and anything else you may need (e.g., work gloves, rain gear).
- Application deadline: Wednesday, January 21.
- Fee: 500 JPY (elementary school children are free if accompanied by a guardian).
- Extra costs apply (transportation, admission fees, etc.). Example local bus fare: 280 JPY (Misakiguchi Station bus stop → Misaki-Higashioka bus stop).
- Wear comfortable, non-slip shoes (e.g., sneakers).
- Insurance/compensation for accidents is limited to the scope of the guide association’s insurance policy.
- After the tour: Jogashima bus stop → Misakiguchi Station (about 30 minutes, 450 JPY).

Link:
- Event page (Yokosuka City Tourism Info): https://www.cocoyoko.net/event/post-248.html
- Tour application site (Yokosuka City Guide Association): http://yokosuka.kankoh-guide.com/index.html
